extendedInfo.description: AUTHORIZATION KEY NO LONGER REQUIRED FOR BETA TESTING - APP WILL EXPIRE EVERY TWO WEEKS UNTIL BETA TESTING IS COMPLETEEmote will be transitioning to a week trial when the final release hits, with an in-app purchase to unlock premium features.____________________________________________________________Do you have an audio system connected to a Windows 7-based HTPC running Windows Media Center? If so, now you can be the DJ of the party or even all alone from any room in your home.Browse your Windows 7 Media Center music library by albums, album artists, artists, and genre.Easily search your songs, artists, or genre from within the app for easy access.Play or enqueue albums or songs, and control your queue with play, skip, pause, and stop functions. You can even use your phone's volume keys to control your Media Center volume!Create saved playlists for easy access to frequent music.Integrated global phone search from any homescreen on your phone, even use your voice to search.Ongoing notification with track and artist when music is playing on your Media Center (Android 4.0+ has additional play/pause and skip forward buttons)New Jelly Bean (4.1) expandable notification with large album artIntegrated lockscreen music controls with album art on Android 4.0+REQUIRED FOR FUNCTIONALITY: You must install a small Windows Media Center plugin that can be found for 32- or 64-bit Windows 7 at my support website.

reviews.title: Crashes...no good...
reviews.comment: This kinda worked on my lg thrill but was slow. Just got a Samsung tab2...thought I would give it a try again. Force close each time it attempts to build library...so either the updates have caused more errors...or it doesn\'t work on a tablet...too bad, on the bigger screen and faster machine I though it would be cool...nope...uninstalling...too bad.  I looked forward to using this on the tablet.
reviews.author: Gary Dennis

reviews.title: No Worky
reviews.comment: Don\'t work...fails test on my ASUS and LG

reviews.title: Love It !
reviews.comment: Exactly what I needed to use my tablet to view & control my Media Center music. It works great. Now I don\'t need my 40\" LCD on using lots of energy. The developer is very responsive and what ever small bugs there are will be worked out soon I\'m sure.   Neil
reviews.author: A Google User
